name.name: name
name.caption: Name
name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.

string.name: callbackUrl
string.caption: Callback Url
string.description:
The callbackUrl is the endpoint that is registered in the iApp to handle the response of the authorization call. This endpoint also has to direct to the handleAuthentication process of the connector
Note:This param is now optional because it can be specified in the Authenticate or in here (config).

string.name: clientId
string.caption: Client Id
string.description:
Your Client ID (OAuth Client ID), which identifies who you are. You can access the client_id in your app's developer dashboard under the Summary section.
Note:This param is now optional because it can be specified in the Authenticate or in here (config).

string.name: hubId
string.caption: Hub Id
string.description:
The HubSpot portal ID of the customer that you're re-directing. You will need to get the portal ID from the customer who you're making the request for.
In order to find the Hub ID follow this link: <a href="http://help.hubspot.com/articles/How_To_Doc/How-to-find-your-hub-id">http://help.hubspot.com/articles/How_To_Doc/How-to-find-your-hub-id
Note:This param is now optional because it can be specified in the Authenticate or in here (config).

string.name: scope
string.caption: Scope
string.description:
The scopes (or permissions) you want. These should match your application settings in the Marketplace. Separate more than one scope with an space character "Ex:scope-a offline"
Important: the scope offline provides the ability to refresh the token automatically once this has expired. If you do not specify this scope, once the token expires the call to a process will throw a HubSpotConnectorAccessTokenExpiredException
Note: the scope required in the authentication must be supported by the application. This can be checked in the Application Settings, under Scopes
For a complete list of the available scopes check this link: http://developers.hubspot.com/auth/oauth_scopes
Note:This param is now optional because it can be specified in the Authenticate or in here (config).

string.name: objectStore-ref
string.caption: Object Store Reference
string.description: The object store to store the user credentials.

globalRef.name: config-ref
globalRef.caption: Connector Configuration
globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.

cloud-connector.caption: HubSpot
cloud-connector.description:
HubSpot all-in-one marketing software helps more than 8,000 companies in 56 countries attract leads and convert them into customers. A pioneer in inbound marketing, HubSpot aims to help its customers make marketing that people actually love.
The connector is using the version "v1" of the HubSpot API.
The documentation of the API can be found in this link
The main flow of the connector is "authentication" ---> HubSpot Login Page ----> "authenticationResponse" ----> Any other process of the connector.

mode.modeLabel: Add existing contact in a list
Update email subscription status unsubscribe from all

cloud-connector.caption: Add Existing Contact In A List

string.name: contactId
string.caption: Contact Id
string.description: The contact ID of the contact that you're adding to the list.

string.name: listId
string.caption: List Id
string.description: You need to include the ID for the list you're adding the lead to. You can search for lists using the get lists method.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.caption: Callback Url
string.description: Use this callback instead the one in the configuration.

string.caption: Client Id
string.description: Use this clientId instead the one in the configuration.

string.name: hubId
string.caption: Hub Id
string.description: Use this hubId instead the one in the configuration.

string.name: scope
string.caption: Scope
string.description: Use this scope instead the one in the configuration.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: This user identifier it is the one that will we used from now on to the successive calls to the process of this connector for this user.

string.description: The input parameters that came with the response to the authenticate process.

string.caption: Contact Property Name
string.description: The name of the custom property to be deleted.

string.description: The name of the group to be deleted.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: contactOffset
string.caption: Contact Offset
string.description: This parameter will offset the contacts returned to you, based on the unique ID of the contacts in a given portal. Contact unique IDs are assigned by the order that they are created in the system. This means for instance, if you specify a vidOffset offset of 5, and you have 20 contacts in the portal you're working in, the contacts with IDs 6-20 will be returned to you.

string.name: count
string.caption: Count
string.description: This parameter lets you specify the amount of contacts to return in your API call. The default for this parameter (if it isn't specified) is 20 contacts. The maximum amount of contacts you can have returned to you via this parameter is 100.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: count
string.caption: Count
string.description: This parameter lets you specify the amount of contacts to return in your API call. The default for this parameter (if it isn't specified) is 20 contacts. The maximum amount of contacts you can have returned to you via this parameter is 100.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

integer.name: waterMark
integer.caption: Water Mark
integer.description: The waterMark used to filter the Contacts that were updated after that waterMark.

string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: contactEmail
string.caption: Contact Email
string.description: The email address for the contact that you're searching for.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: contactId
string.caption: Contact Id
string.description: Unique identifier for a particular contact. In HubSpot's contact system, contact ID's are called "vid".

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: contactUserToken
string.caption: Contact User Token
string.description: The user token (HubSpot cookie) for the contact that you're searching for.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: listId
string.caption: List Id
string.description: Unique identifier for the list that you're looking for.

string.caption: User Id

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: count
string.caption: Count
string.description: This parameter lets you specify the amount of contacts to return in your API call. The default for this parameter (if it isn't specified) is 20 contacts. The maximum amount of contacts you can have returned to you via this parameter is 100.

string.name: query
string.caption: Query
string.description: The search term for what you're searching for. You can use all of a word or just parts of a word as well. For example, if you we're searching for contacts with "hubspot" in their name or email, searching for "hub" would also return contacts with "hubspot" in their email address.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: count
string.caption: Count
string.description: This parameter lets you specify the amount of contacts to return in your API call. The default for this parameter (if it isn't specified) is 20 contacts. The maximum amount of contacts you can have returned to you via this parameter is 100.

string.name: listId
string.caption: List Id
string.description: Unique identifier for the list that you're looking for.

string.name: offset
string.caption: Offset
string.description: This parameter will offset the contacts returned to you, based on the unique ID of the contacts in a given portal. Contact unique IDs are assigned by the order that they are created in the system. This means for instance, if you specify a vidOffset offset of 5, and you have 20 contacts in the portal you're working in, the contacts with IDs 6-20 will be returned to you.

string.name: property
string.caption: Property
string.description: If you include the "property" parameter, then the properties in the "contact" object in the returned data will only include the property or properties that you request.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: count
string.caption: Count
string.description: An integer that represents the number of lists that you want returned to your call. By default, this call will return 20 lists to you. If you want more or different list returned to you, you'll want to use the "offset" parameter.

string.name: offset
string.caption: Offset
string.description: An integer that represents where to start your list pull from. For instance, if you want to return numbered lists: 50-60, your offset should be "50" and your count parameter (seen above) should be 10. You should also note that the returned JSON (seen below) includes a "has-more" field, which lets you know if there are more lists that you can pull. If "has-more" is true, you can use this offset parameter to pull lists that weren't in your initial call.

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: groupName
string.caption: Group Name
string.description: The name of the group to be retrieved.

string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: count
string.caption: Count
string.description: An integer that represents the number of lists that you want returned to your call. By default, this call will return 20 lists to you. If you want more or different list returned to you, you'll want to use the "offset" parameter.

string.name: offset
string.caption: Offset
string.description: An integer that represents where to start your list pull from. For instance, if you want to return numbered lists: 50-60, your offset should be "50" and your count parameter (seen above) should be 10. You should also note that the returned JSON (seen below) includes a "has-more" field, which lets you know if there are more lists that you can pull. If "has-more" is true, you can use this offset parameter to pull lists that weren't in your initial call.

string.name: email

string.name: hubId
string.caption: Hub Id
string.description: (portalId) The HubSpot Portal ID for the portal that you're making the call for. If left empty it will use the one stored in the credentials (authenticate operation).

string.name: userId
string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.name: contactOffset
string.caption: Contact Offset
string.description: Used in conjunction with the timeOffset paramter to page through the recent contacts. Every call to this endpoint will return a vid-offset value. This value is used in the vidOffset parameter of the next call to get the next page of contacts.

string.name: count
string.caption: Count
string.description: This parameter lets you specify the amount of contacts to return in your API call. The default for this parameter (if it isn't specified) is 20 contacts. The maximum amount of contacts you can have returned to you via this parameter is 100.

string.name: timeOffset
string.caption: Time Offset
string.description: Used in conjunction with the vidOffset paramter to page through the recent contacts. Every call to this endpoint will return a time-offset value. This value is used in the timeOffset parameter of the next call to get the next page of contacts.

string.caption: User Id
string.description: The UserID of the user in the HubSpot service that was obtained from the process.

string.description: This parameter lets you specify the amount of contacts to return in your API call. The default for this parameter (if it isn't specified) is 20 contacts. The maximum amount of contacts you can have returned to you via this parameter is 100.

radioBoolean.name: useReference
radioBoolean.caption: Reference or expression
radioBoolean.description: Provide a reference to a bean or use an expression

element-controller-map.caption: Custom Properties
element-controller-map.description:
If the property is not included in the attributes in this class, it will be added as a customProperties key, value pair.
Also for the create/update, you can add properties in here that are custom and will be sended to the service.
